title: West Side Story's Rachel Zegler shares a new YouTube video after being called a 'homewrecker'
text:
Rachel Zegler shared a new YouTube video on Monday of a new cover song as her West Side Story co-star Ansel Elgort's 'fans' have been calling her a 'homewrecker.'

While the 17-year-old said she was taking time off from Twitter after trolls came for the young star, she made sure to share a message of kindness along with the video.

Her cover of Lana Del Rey's song Hope Is A Dangerous Thing For A Woman Like Me to Have – But I Have It didn't feature her face, but instead showed a simple message that said 'spread love.'

Spreading love: Rachel Zegler shared a new YouTube video on Monday of a new cover song amid her co-star Ansel Elgort's 'fans' calling her a 'homewrecker'

Her message: While the young star said she was taking time off from Twitter after trolls came for the young star, she made sure to share a message of kindness along with the video

In action: Rachel and her famous co-star Ansel Elgort are pictured above filming their new movie West Side Story

She went on in the caption, writing: 'Just… be kind. there's not much more i can say but just be nice to each other. be there for your friends. be a friend. be family. be kind. spread love. don't assume, always approach the world with an open heart and open mind. my love for you all is undying. love each other. love you. xo.'

Just days before when production wrapped for their new movie, the star shared in a now-deleted tweet about her love and appreciation for her famous co-star writing: 'There really aren't enough words to describe the pride I have in Ansel's growth and beauty and literal magic he possesses on screen and off. Falling in love with him was easy. Happy wrap mi amor; catch ya on a fire escape sometime soon.'

Both stars will play Tony and Maria in the Steven Spielberg remake set to premiere in 2020.

But with Ansel Elgort's, 25, recent interview with The Sunday Times about his interest in pursuing non-sexual relationships with more than just his high-school sweetheart Violetta Komyshan, the timing appeared off to some of Ansel's followers who quickly called out Rachel.

Now deleted: Rachel took to Twitter to praise her co-star before taking down the tweet after Ansel's recent interview surfaced of him wanting to find more love beyond what he has with his high school sweetheart

Newcomer: Rachel is pictured about filming for Steven Spielberg's new film outside of a fake subway station

'The internet has made me upset so goodbye for a bit be nice to each other,' the Latina actress wrote on her Twitter on Thursday before taking a step back from social media.

'The fact that I have to say something is absolutely absurd,' she also added before deleting the post before adding that she was being called a 'homewrecker' and it was 'heartbreaking.'

She also took to her Instagram story to spread the same message as well writing: 'kindness and love conquer all.'

Focusing: Ansel is seen filming at night in Uptown, Manhattan on the set of the famous remake

While the Baby Driver actor has yet to sound off his fan base for the mean comments towards his co-star, he didn't hold anything back when talking about his expectations in his relationship with his ballerina girlfriend.

'I'd like to have done a few plays and performed my music,' he said during his interview with the outlet. 'I'd also like to find a lot more love.'

'It doesn't need to be sexual. I could be done sexually with my girlfriend,' Ansel said, who has been dating Violetta since they were in high-school with just a few short breaks in between.

'I think we've been pretty clear that I want to feel free to fall in love with people and that [option] should be open, but sexually it can be closed off.'

He also added that he's 'in love with a bunch of my male friends who I'm not interested in having sex with, so why can't I put the desire to have sex with women aside and let myself have love with women?'
description: Rachel Zegler shared a new YouTube video on Monday of a new cover song amid her co-star Ansel Elgort's 'fans' calling her a 'homewrecker.' While the 17-year-old said she was taking time off.
